intro: Bartsia keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan bartsia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly Kenya. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in whorls, and are usually pink or white in color. Bartsia keniensis is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves.
